required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Acupuncture in Post-Mastectomy Patients With Tissue Expanders
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Acupuncture in Post-Mastectomy Patients With Tissue Expanders

lead_sponsor.agency: New York University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: New York University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate changes in shoulder tightness, chest tightness, and general pain related to post-mastectomy reconstructive surgery with tissue expansion in women who are randomized to receive acupuncture treatment immediately after surgery (twice a week for 6 weeks) compared to those who are randomized to no acupuncture treatment for 6 weeks, but offered acupuncture at the end of the 6 week study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Shoulder Tightness Score on Pain and Discomfort Assessment Questionnaire
Chest Tightness Score on Pain and Discomfort Assessment Questionnaire
General Pain Score on Pain and Discomfort Assessment Questionnaire

arm_group.arm_group_label: Acupuncture Treatment After 6 Weeks of Recovery

intervention.description: acupuncture treatment immediately after surgery (twice a week for 6 weeks)
no acupuncture treatment for 6 weeks, but offered acupuncture at the end of the 6 week study period.
intervention.arm_group_label: Acupuncture Treatment After 6 Weeks of Recovery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who are newly diagnosed with breast cancer, enrolled in the The Breast Cancer Database of NYU Cancer Center (BCD) and who are having breast cancer surgery involving a mastectomy procedure with insertion of a tissue expander for reconstructive purposes
- Women who are newly diagnosed with breast cancer
- Women who are enrolled in the Breast Cancer Database (BCD)
- Women who are having breast cancer surgery involving a mastectomy procedure with insertion of a tissue expander for reconstructive purposes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who had neoadjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy, women who are currently on anticoagulant therapy, women who are having breast reconstruction with Alloderm, women who have chronic pre-operative pain, and/or women who have had a history of previous implants or prior augmentations
- Women who had neoadjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy
- Women who are currently on anticoagulant therapy
- Women who are having breast reconstruction with Alloderm
- Women who have chronic pre-operative pain
- Women who have had a history of previous implants or prior augmentations
- Women who are currently on anticoagulant therapy
- Women who are having breast reconstruction with Alloderm
- Women who have chronic pre-operative pain
- Women who have had a history of previous implants or prior augmentations

facility.name: New York University School of Medicine
